item.title: Brute.Fail: Watch brute force attacks fail in real time
item.description: - Brute.Fail showcases real-time examples of attackers trying to break into servers by guessing usernames and passwords.

item.title: California spent $17B on homelessness ‚Äì¬†it's not working
item.description: - California has spent $17 billion on homelessness, but the problem persists.

item.title: Third-party Reddit apps are being crushed by price increases
item.description: - Third-party apps like Apollo and Infinity are being priced out of the market due to new charges implemented by Reddit for accessing its API.

item.title: Radiation-hardened Quine (2014)
item.description: - Radiation-hardened Quine is a self-printing program written in Ruby that works even if you delete a character from the code.

item.title: How to make fancy road trip maps with R & OpenStreetMap
item.description: - Andrew Heiss explains how he used OpenStreetMap, R, `sf`, and `ggplot2` to create road trip maps.

item.title: 27 years later & the Psion 3a is still wonderful (2020)
item.description: - Psion 3a, a PDA released in 1993, is still functional after 27 years and has many innovative features.

item.title: Scan iPhone backups for traces of compromise by "Operation Triangulation"
item.description: - A new script called Triangle Check can scan iTunes backups for indicators of compromise by "Operation Triangulation".

item.title: It's not wrong that "ü§¶üèº‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è".length == 7 (2019)
item.description: - The article explores the different ways programming languages define and measure string length, specifically when it comes to Unicode and emojis.

item.title: He made linear algebra fun
item.description: - Professor Gil Strang has retired from MIT after spending 66 of his 88 years at the institution.

item.title: Parachute use to prevent death, trauma when jumping from aircraft (2018) [pdf]
